Articles.Content:
Warning: Large images!

Up for release soon after the passenger cabin is complete, is the;

Trojan SA-APC Mk2

Above: On the left is the prototype and un-named T3 light tank, and on the right is the prototype of the Trojan, the Mk1 T.

Fully modeled interior (Passenger cabin coming soon)

Below: On the left if the commanders capsule, on the right is the radio operators capsule, in the middle is the platoon commanders seat and on the slight left all the way at the back of the image, is the driver capsule.

Below: This is the radio operators position. Its still a work in progress, but I attempted to make a computer screen with the solar panel, some sort of operating equipment with the solar panel box, some miscellaneous controls with the communications poles, and finally the periscope (Only one visable) is the little white rectangle on the right of the computer screen.

Below: This is the radio antenna outside the radio operators position, just thought i'd mention it as there isnt as much detail complete as id like to showcase.

Below: This is the commanders position, as mentioned above, the rectangles (Many of them, as the commander needs a 360 degree view of the world) are the periscopes, along with the solar panel as a computer screen also with some miscellaneous controls as the communications poles.

Below: These are the hatches from the outside, they have fully modeled periscopes and hatch turning lock in the form of an RCS block.

OTHER INTERIOR POSITIONS WILL BE FINISHED SOON!

Below: This is the prototype, Tuscan wire guided missile launch platform.

Below: Is the 2500kg Wire guided High Explosive Anti-Tank Tandem warhead missile, or shortened to 2.5t WG-HEAT Tandem known as the X4. With a still not fully tested range of 4km+, guided or un-guided 500kg warhead, this is a promising but still prototype weapon system.

Awesome. what's the part count?

Brace yourselves... 358...

Thats the price you pay for detail and realism
Oh and Zekes, if you get round to reading this, tell me whatcha think
I am going to have to make my own ones now! bye the way good job
whoa man, you really went to town on the detail. looks awesome inside and out

whoa man, you really went to town on the detail. looks awesome inside and out

Thanks! Funny thing is, it isnt even complete yet!

*Edit: Love your truck btw, thats what prompted me to make this one in particular!

Edited June 17, 2013 by deskjetser
Very nice, how long it took to build?

Very nice, how long it took to build?

What Ive got so far is about 8 hours of sitting and tweaking until everything was just right
8 hours, not too bad. How much it weight? May be nice to send it to other worlds

How much it weight? May be nice to send it to other worlds

Well it was never intended to leave kerbin, I would imagine you would have severe lag problems with all the physics at work. But it weighs in at 22t, its going to be around 25t-29t when completed. I wont allow it to be heavier than 30t, that wouldnt be realistic for a wheeled APC.
you say its semi-amphibious could we get some pictures of it in the water? very cool looking when the download for it comes out im downloading for sure

Oh and Zekes, if you get round to reading this, tell me whatcha think

Shoot, may be a bit late but it's really good looking. The missiles are awesome too, wish there was a download.
